Triggering Event: After school, she noticed a crumpled note in her desk drawer. It was from a student, expressing feelings of loneliness and disappointment in her latest grade. She felt a pang of guilt, realizing she'd been too focused on other classes to notice his struggle.
Generated Assessment: Ugh I can't believe this guy is still sitting alone at lunch, he must be so sad. Why didn't anyone tell me about him? If only I had known earlier, maybe I could've helped him somehow. But no, now it's too late. He just looks so lost, like he doesn't even care anymore. And what's with that stupid test? Of course he failed it, he's not even trying. How does he expect to pass when he hasn't studied anything? I know for a fact he did all the homework and got all A's, but that's not enough. He needs more than just grades, he needs someone to talk to. Maybe if I'd asked him sooner, he wouldn't feel so hopeless now. Now he'll probably skip school and end up failing the semester, and then where will he go next? The thought of him leaving school makes me sick. What am I supposed to do? I'm already overworked, and now I have to deal with this? This is ridiculous. I need to get my priorities straight, but I don't want to let him down either. He's just another forgotten soul, left behind by everyone else. I should've seen it coming; why didn't I notice sooner?

Triggering Event: Every evening, she'd visit her old partner's grave at the veterans' cemetery. Today, rain poured down, drenching her uniform. As she knelt to replace the worn flowers with fresh ones, her knees groaned in protest. A gust of wind blew a faded photograph from his casket - their wedding day. She picked it up, feeling the misery of loss and loneliness heavier than the rain.
Generated Assessment: Fuck this shit! I'm so angry right now. It all started when my friend visited her ex-boyfriend's grave again. The rain was pouring down, but she didn't care because she wanted to keep visiting him. She even brought flowers for him! As she sat there, the wind blew away her favorite photo. What the fuck is wrong with these people? They're still crying over him like he died today instead of years ago. My friend went crazy, picking up that photo, and now she's just sobbing uncontrollably. This isn't funny anymore. I hate seeing her cry about some asshole who dumped her. It gets worse. I saw how she acted toward other guys too. She barely gave them a chance because she was still "in love" with her ex. Now she thinks she's better than everyone else just because she has feelings left for her ex. Her friends are tired of being ignored. But does she care? No fucking way. My friend's behavior is ridiculous. She keeps talking about how much she misses him. Even though we know they broke up, she insists he loves her. Does she really think he cares? Maybe if she'd just get over him already, things would be different. But no, she won't let go. This whole thing is insane. We've tried to tell her to move on, but she refuses to listen. Instead, she keeps telling us about her ex, making us feel like idiots for suggesting she might find

Triggering Event: A 45-year-old female journalist, in a committed relationship, sits at her cluttered desk, deadline looming. She clicks open an email from her editor, expecting final draft approval, but finds instead a harsh critique of her latest piece, marked with red ink and dismissive comments. As she reads, her partner enters the room, humming off-key, oblivious to the tension. Irritation spikes within her; she snaps, "Can you please not right now?"
Generated Assessment: "Are you fucking kidding me? You can't even be bothered to keep your voice down? I'm trying to work here and it's impossible! Can you just leave me alone?"

Triggering Event: During her lunch break, she found a used needle in their shared park bench, where they usually sit together.

They could've died today. Why did I even come out here? Why are you so dumb, you fucking idiot?! You're going to die because of your stupid fucking self! This is all your fault. He didn't care enough for me anyway. Maybe I'd still be alive if he cared more. I wouldn't have gotten infected if he loved me. He's gone, and I'm still here. What the fuck is wrong with me? Triggering Event: She hesitated at the door, her heart pounding in her chest like it had been for days now. The house was quiet, too quiet. She could swear she heard footsteps echoing through the empty halls when no one was there. Her partner, home from their shift early due to illness, had left the front door ajar. An invitation for the unknown, or a chilling reminder of what could be lurking?
Generated Assessment: She’s always been a little weird about this place. I know it’s old, but come on, she can’t seriously think that every creak is a ghost trying to get out? It’s just the wind settling into the walls. I’ve lived here with her for five years, and we’ve never seen anything other than dust bunnies and cobwebs. This is ridiculous. When I got back, she was pacing around the living room like a wild animal, muttering something about “the shadows” and “watching us.” What does she expect to see? Monsters under the bed? Come on. We’ve watched enough horror movies; let’s keep our feet on the ground. Besides, if there were actual ghosts, wouldn’t they have shown up by now? Five years? That’s a long time. If this house was haunted, we’d have seen signs by now. It’s probably just her stress. She’s been acting strange all day, ever since she came home from work. A bit too stressed, maybe, but you don’t start thinking ghosts just because someone is a little anxious. I’m going to go talk to her, calm her down. She needs me right now. And besides, who really believes in ghosts anyway? It’s not like we’re the first people to live here. There’s plenty of explanations for the creaks and groans. Let’s focus on reality instead of some wild imagination. It’s time to snap her back

Triggering Event: He walked past their old apartment, still adorned with her favorite plants he'd once nurtured but now wilting. A fresh bouquet of daisies, her favorites, lay on the doorstep, a stark reminder of his replacement's affection. He clenched his fist around the brush in his hand, the bristles digging into his palm as he imagined them together inside, laughing at memories that no longer included him.
Generated Assessment: He was a fucking idiot for feeling like this. What did I expect? That he would forget about her after years of being together? They're both stupid for even talking to each other again. The way she smiles when seeing him is disgusting; it makes me want to punch a wall. If anything, I'm glad he has moved on. It means I can finally move on too. He doesn't care about me anymore, just like how she didn't care when we broke up. Now he's with someone who actually cares, and I'll be alone forever. I need to stop thinking about her. She doesn't deserve me anyway, and neither does he.

Triggering Event: A 28-year-old doctor, wearily scrolling through her phone after a long shift, stops at an unopened message from a familiar number. She hesitates before tapping it open to reveal a concise note: "Hi, it's [Name]. I've met someone. Let's still be friends?" Her heart sinks as she feels the cold weight of rejection.
Generated Assessment: You're telling me this just out of the blue? Without warning? That you’ve found someone else? You’re just going to stop being my friend like that? It doesn’t even make sense. We’ve been friends for years. Why would you do something like that? And now you want us to still be friends? Are you kidding me?

Triggering Event: A parent storms into her classroom after school hours, shouting, "This isn't good enough! You're failing my kid!" She shoves a crumpled report card onto her desk.
Generated Assessment: "Wow, I'm really surprised she's freaking out about this. It doesn't seem like there are many red flags in the report card. However, I did notice a few things that might be concerning. Firstly, the teacher's comments section is full of negative feedback. The student received a 20% deduction for not turning in their assignments on time, which could significantly impact their grade. Additionally, the teacher mentioned that the student struggled with understanding some concepts, but didn't provide specific examples. Secondly, the overall grade point average (GPA) is lower than expected. While the student has shown improvement over the previous semester, they still need to work harder to catch up. Thirdly, the teacher's comment about the student being'struggling' raises concerns. This might mean the student needs additional support or accommodations to succeed in the class. I would recommend speaking with the teacher to understand the situation better and identify potential solutions. Fourthly, the parent's reaction seems extreme. Storming into the classroom mid-afternoon may cause unnecessary stress for both the student and me. Perhaps we can discuss alternative ways for the parent to communicate with me, such as scheduling a meeting before or after school? Overall, while these issues are certainly important, they don't necessarily indicate a catastrophic outcome. With proper guidance and support, the student can improve their grades and overcome challenges."

Triggering Event:
Scenario:

She noticed it as she locked up the hospital ward for the night—a faint scuffling sound from behind the supply closet door. Her heart pounded, echoing in her ears. She'd heard whispers of a new, untested drug circulating among patients. Could they be onto her? She'd been asking too many questions about their sudden withdrawals and strange behavior. She hesitated, then quietly called out, "Who's there?" No response. Just the soft rustle of something... or someone... moving in the dark. Her hand trembled as she reached for her flashlight, determined to uncover the truth, no matter what lurked behind that door.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, I'm so scared! I can't believe this is happening right now. I've had some weird experiences lately, but this is crazy. I was just talking to Dr. Smith about how some of these patients have been acting really strangely—like, they're just lying there staring at nothing. And now, I hear this noise... It sounds like something is moving around back there. I hope it's not one of those new drugs we've been hearing about. They say it makes people act really weird. What if it's something like that? I don't know why I'm freaking out so much. Maybe because I feel like I've done something wrong. I didn't mean to ask too many questions, but I guess I am getting a little paranoid. That's probably it. But what if I did something bad? I don't even want to think about it. I'm trying not to, but... Ugh. This whole situation feels so overwhelming. I'm trying to stay calm, but I keep thinking, What if I messed up? What if I did something terrible? Why does this have to happen to me? I wish I could go home and forget all about it, but I can't. My mind keeps racing with thoughts about everything that could go wrong. I feel like I need to leave, but where would I go? I'm stuck here, waiting to see what happens next. Please tell me it's not going to be worse than this

Triggering Event: Every Tuesday, she volunteers at the hospital's gift shop, a place filled with reminders of her late husband's time there. Today, a young couple, laughing loudly over a selection of greeting cards, catches her eye. They're around the same age he was when they first met. She feels her jaw tighten as she watches them, their happiness feeling like a personal affront.
Generated Assessment: Oh my god, I can't even handle this anymore. Watching that couple made me feel so angry - it felt like I was being ripped apart all over again. It's just so unfair how I still have to deal with these feelings after all this time. I'm really sick of this emotional rollercoaster. It's ridiculous. How could someone be so happy? Doesn't anyone care about what I've been through? This is such an obvious reminder that I'll never find love like that again, and I'm just so tired of it. Why does everyone get to move on while I'm stuck here? It's just so frustrating! Everything is so unfair right now. I need to take a break from all this stress. I wish people would understand how hard it is for me to see others having fun when I'm still dealing with everything I am. Just thinking about it makes me want to scream. What if they were my husband? Would they be smiling at those cards too? The thought alone gives me hives. This is all so pointless. I don't know how much more of this I can handle. Ugh, why does it always have to be like this? Life is so unfair. I hate it. I'm going to go cry in a corner now because I just can't handle watching something as simple as buying a card make me feel so miserable.
